benchmark_details.name: STRIDE-QA (Spatio-Temporal Reasoning In Driving Scenarios for Ego-centric Visual Question Answering)
benchmark_details.overview: STRIDE-QA is a large-scale visual question answering (VQA) dataset designed for spatiotemporal reasoning in urban driving, consisting of 285 K frames and 16 million QA pairs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of STRIDE-QA is to enable fine-grained spatial reasoning and temporal prediction in visual question answering for autonomous driving.

data.source: Self-collected multi-sensor driving data from urban areas in Tokyo.
data.size: 100 hours of driving data, 285 K frames, 16 million QA pairs
data.annotation: Automatically generated through a modular pipeline combining LiDAR and multi-camera data.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on spatial and temporal predictions compared to ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Higher LSR, MLSR, and TLC scores indicate better spatiotemporal reasoning capabilities.
methodology.baseline_results: Baseline models included GPT-4o and InternVL2.5-8B, showing significantly lower performance compared to STRIDE-QA fine-tuned models.
methodology.validation: Validation procedures were carried out using manually verified annotations.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset includes automatic blurring of identifiable faces and license plates.
